creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
The ANT copy command does not preserve the case of file 
names on Windows NT.  The destination file's names are 
in all lower case.

creator: nico@apache.org
text:
If copying a whole directory file-case is preserved. If copying a single file 
and tofile is specified the specified name of the tofile is used. If copying a 
single file and the tofile is not specified (using todir) and you use a name 
that is different from the 'correct' name (specified 'TEST.TXT' instead 
of 'test.txt' which is shown by a dir, ant uses the name of the specified 
source as the name of the target.
